text: The Division of Nepean was an Australian Electoral Division for the Australian House of Representatives in the state of New South Wales. The division was created in 1949. It was abolished in 1993. It was named after British politician Evan Nepean. It was located in the suburbs of Granville, Lithgow, Penrith. ==Members== Image Member Party Term Notes Anti-Socialist 12 December 1906 – 26 May 1909 Lost seat. Later elected to Nepean in 1919 Commonwealth Liberal – 13 April 1910 Lost seat. Later elected to Nepean in 1919 Labor – 31 May 1913 Lost seat. Later elected to the New South Wales Legislative Assembly seat of Canterbury in 1914 Commonwealth Liberal – 17 February 1917 Served as minister under Hughes. Retired Nationalist – 3 November 1919 Served as minister under Hughes. Retired Nationalist – 16 December 1922 Elected to the Division of Parramatta after Nepean was abolished in 1922 Nepean Category:1906 establishments in Australia Category:1922 disestablishments Category:1920s disestablishments in Australia
title: Division of Nepean
